website_summaries.verdict: Fits like its customized for your ears with a high energy sound.
pros: Current customers report the earbuds are not only comfortable, but maintain their fit and performance for several years
Great for sports as well as regular, everyday use
Well-known brand delivers a high-achieving earbud at an affordable price point
cons: May take some maneuvering to find the right fit in your own ears
Wear for several hours at a time without hurting your ears and even during high intensity activities such as running

customer_reviews.title: They changed the design - what was once pretty good is now pretty bad
customer_reviews.text: They've changed the style of these. The previous style was fantastic. I tend to go through headphones due to a lot of abuse, but the sound was fantastic and had great bass and great at blocking out other noise. Ordered another set of 4 of these (again because I'm hard on headphones) and now the style has changed. Thinner wire, less base, doesn't block out noise as well. I fail to understand why when people have a winning product that they feel the urge to redesign the product and make it worse. I guess it's to save money. Well they need to save their money because I'm certainly not spending any more of my money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Bobcat

customer_reviews.title: Just buy these, seriously
customer_reviews.text: I am at work, next to the window, and there is a LITERAL JACKHAMMER outside the window. I have these headphones in, listening to music, and I can't hear it at all. If you want that in your life, these are the earbuds for you.
customer_reviews.author: megallo

customer_reviews.title: Square-Covered End of Jack
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Sound Quality, Affordable, Comfortable The only downside is the pictures do not indicate the jack has a square-end cover, which prevents usage in some types of cases. If you are sure the headphones will fit in your phone, these are the ones for you! They sound better than some of the $20+ Sony headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Marduk Vi

customer_reviews.title: Seriously awful! Please make sure you read the return policy.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are awful. I arrived them broken yesterday with one headphone not playing sound. Because of the return policy, I can not return them. The headphone that does work sounds like it's underwater.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want $10 disposable earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Might as well be disposable. Great sound and comfortable for a couple of weeks until they break. Great design but cheap, cheap, cheap manufacturing. Might be a good product if anyone else made them. I bought two and on one pair an earbud just completely fell apart and the plastic glue lines just wires holding the speaker on within two weeks. In another two weeks the other pair had just one speaker completely go out, no reason, no damage, just no sound... don't waste your money spend the extra $10 and get a decently made product.
customer_reviews.author: Huston Hastie

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic - Just one more example of Too Big To Fail
customer_reviews.text: No good - one side broke within 1st week of use. Panasonic pulled this product off the market . . . and per Chat with a Panasonic Agent this morning . . . they have totally discontinued making these Headphones. BUT - you are welcome to return it to them at a Warranty Handling Cost that is EQUAL TO THE COST OF BUYING A NEW ONE . . . Oh Yes . . . We get to pay them twice for replacing their defective headphones. Good-bye forever Panasonic! Just one more example of Too Big To Fail. Wishing you as much continued success as you deserve for your non-handling of an obviously defective product.
customer_reviews.author: The Ness

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in how quickly these break. They used to be my go-to headphones for casual use, decent sound and you didn't care too much if something happened to them. I would buy a new pair every year or so. But the last 3 times I bought them, they stopped working within a month. At this point I have to assume it's not just bad luck. and they aren't as durable as they used to be. This is a real shame because I like how they fit, I can wear them for hours without making my ears uncomfortable. Unfortunately I'll have to find a new brand. I can't keep throwing money away.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kish

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a month
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on November 4th and it already stopped functioning; the month isn't even over yet. It worked fine for 1 week, then shoddy audio started happening. Then 1 side stopped working. I bought this after reading some rave reviews about the "bang for the buck" and how quality hadn't been compromised despite being budget friendly. I feel duped. The version I bought was without the mic, so I don't know if there's a quality difference between the w/mic and w/o mic versions. In any case, there shouldn't be. Don't offer these products if you can't assure quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alex L. # Panasonic RP-TCM125-K
customer_reviews.text: Received my order yesterday. Greatly dissappointed with the dismally poor quality of this product. The ear bud wires are dangerously thin. The advertised 3.5mm jacks are off spec. - way to small to fit the Amazon Kindle Fire tablet HD8 7th gen. or the LG L62VL smartphone both of proven 3.5mm device ports. At this point, I can only wonder if these advertised "Panasonic" products are cheap counterfeit versions of the real ones that +/- 26k customers reviewed , which found their way into the Amazon inventory. In any case AVOID this product until quality control personnel at both Amazon and Panasonic redress this matter.
customer_reviews.author: A.R.L. 21

customer_reviews.title: Terrible earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these about 7 weeks ago, gave them to my wife who told me that one of the earbuds was cutting out. After 3-4 uses my wife reports that one side is now dead. Absolutely terrible product quality. Because I'm outside of the Amazon return window, I contacted Panasonic who wanted me to pay to return this $12 item to their repair center. Since my shipping cost will be close to the cost of buying another set of earbuds, I opted to just throw these in the trash. Save yourself the time, money, and aggravation and buy another product instead of these.
customer_reviews.author: RobG

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Decent
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it does its job. Sometimes the buttons don't work as expected but the sound quality is good enough to enjoy a really crisp and quality volume when watching movies or listening to songs from your phone. I've used this with my android tablet and my iPhone, it works well on both.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: They do not last.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these earbuds for only 7 months and they no longer work. Very disappointed and would not recommend. Update: Panasonic customer service terrible. Called to ask about warranty. When I purchased these on Amazon, I chose them because it stated a 1 year warranty. Now this information has been taken off Amazon, apparently because it was an error. I even spoke to Panasonic confirming date of purchase and they told me to send them in for replacement. They were retuned stating out of warranty. Was only 90 day. Now I understand. They are not worth $10. They were charging $25 to repair.
customer_reviews.author: WP

customer_reviews.title: Junk, and so is the Panasonic warranty
customer_reviews.text: I tested these headphones straight out of the package and noticed that the left earpiece did not work. I looked into the warranty information on the packaging/website and this product, in this situation, is supposed to be covered. I contacted Panasonic (Professional Electronics/PE Americas) and went through the entire warranty/service request process. I received an email later that day confirming that they had received the service request. It has now been 1 month and I have not received any other updates from them. I am assuming at this point that they are not interested in honoring their warranty on this brand new product. This is the last time I purchase Panasonic brand. If anything changes I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed by these little earbuds as soon as I put them in. I realized I only had lightning headphones and needed something cheap and simple for conference calls. These certainly do the trick. The design is great and they even cancel out the sound of my partner when he is on calls in the same room. My respect for the Panasonic name just went up a little bit. I don’t know if I just got lucky but they also fit in my ears instantly, none of that constantly adjusting and hoping they don’t fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Emily E.

customer_reviews.title: Gone through 2 pairs in 3 months - In Middle Schooler vs Earbud - Middle Schooler wins....
customer_reviews.text: I keep reading how these have held up well and are good for 'kids' - but we've gone through three pairs - two in the past 3 months alone, so they clearly do not hold up for us. My daughter uses these in school for Spanish Labs, and mostly at home to listen to music and video. At home they are left 'around' and in school they are placed within her padded chromebook case, so not the most abused ear buds. I'm getting a little tired of ordering new ones, so despite the advice in other reviews to 'buy in bulk' - I may just buy another brand and see if they last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Ella's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but quality is lacking
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these earbuds and this set is not as durable as the first purchased. Two issues with these headphones. First, the wires connecting the earbuds and the power are very thin and not durable. In the first three weeks, a tug on the power end pulled the wiring loose. Still works, but I am anticipating failure soon. Second, the volume setting required to amplify the sound in the earbuds is much higher than my old set. This is in direct comparison to my previous set that is still functional. I realize they didn't cost much, but I expected this set to last and performance as well as my first purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kram

customer_reviews.title: Speaker Sound quality is terrible
customer_reviews.text: With 50K customer reviews, I'm in the minority. I use earbuds a lot for work phone calls, have been on the phone better part of 20 hrs / week throughout recent years. The mic seems fine (which is hard to come by so that is a plus), but the speaker quality is rotten, I can't describe but these are the worst I've ever had, almost hurts to have in ear and hear someone talk, my ears hurts from the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ????Works with iPhone ????
customer_reviews.text: This product states that it is compatible with iPhone. Well, you have to use a connect adapter. Now when you plug in the adapter and plug the headphones into that adapter I hear snap, crackle, and popping but no sound. Alright, who can tell me if the headphones or the adapter is the problem? It would seem that if you are selling something that needs something else to work the company would at least offer a product to buy along with their product to give the customer optimum pleasure. Now will attempt to return.
customer_reviews.author: Lennys Mom

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT genuine Panasonic.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought genuine Panasonic headphones in the past and I've been perfectly happy with them. As other reviewers correctly point out in commendable detail, the ones being sold here appear to be counterfeits. They are NOT actual Panasonic headphones, and I would steer clear of them until Amazon gets the matter straightened out. Unlike the ones I've bought in years past, the pair that I purchased in October 2019 had loose connections creating static crackling the first time they were used.
customer_reviews.author: N. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. Pooly Made and Low Quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the great reviews. Here's what I experienced: • The wire is super thin, to the point where you're disappointed at its quality. They feel like they should have cost $5. • A little over a month in, and there's an audible short in the cord where it plugs into the headphone jack. • The microphone is on the right side. Every other set of ear buds I've had put it on the left, but that's just personal preference. It's too late to return them and not worth the effort to contact customer service. This was a pure waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: GarySeven

customer_reviews.title: Sound is muffled.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking Panasonic would put out a quality product, even if the cost was low. I was WRONG. They have good base, but no mids or highs making the sound muffled. In addition, there's no volume rocker. That one button just hangs up on people. LOL.. yeah, I laughed when I pressed it thinking it was a rocker button for volume. Oh, the wires are super thin too. Next time, I'll go with something that's seems more substantial. Every ear bud that came with the multiple phones I've had over the years had better sound quality and were built better...
customer_reviews.author: crabjoe

customer_reviews.title: Poor Manufacturing..?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought these headphones twice. With the first purchase, the wiring became exposed in the cord for the left earbud. I purchased these a second time because I figured my cat had gotten to them or something. With the second purchase, I am currently in the process of losing hearing in the second earbud. A static noise has started to appear & there is a noticeable difference in the sound volume between the two earbuds. I have been cautious with this pair, so there is no reason for the sudden decline in quality except for poor manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of these several years ago and loved them. Unfortunately they were misplaced about 6 months ago and I ordered another pair. The new pair, being handled in the same manner I handled the other pair, had the right side give out in 4 months. Maybe the coronavirus will force them to find a new manufacturer or shut down the counterfeiters, but I may go with a different brand. The sound quality is great for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Used to be of better quality
customer_reviews.text: This is at least my third purchase of these ear buds. However, the third one is the worse quality. The wires got thinner and thinner. Therefore, the chance of a loose connection increased. My last ear buds’ wire, I had to use super glue, in order to prevent the wires from getting out of the ear buds, and loosing the proper connection. Before the super glue treatment, I was able to move those thinner wires way out of the ear buds casing. My last purchase was Oct 3, 2019. Now, Dec. 30, 2019, the right ear bud has a loose contact, and it’s getting worse. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Neunerball

customer_reviews.title: Beware think a million times before choosing this headphone
customer_reviews.text: Poor sound quality.I thought Panasonic is good its the first time I tried buying their headphone.I don't recommend this product.It's waste of money.Sounded so cheap .Greatly disappointed.Beware think a million times before choosing this headphone. If I could return this I would but Its inevitable not to break the packaging so I don't have an option but to keep it..Poor quality or even worst quality.Do not buy this product.Don't waste your money it's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: LEONE

customer_reviews.title: The microphone doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Tried two pairs of these and the microphone and volume control did not work on either. Returned both. Expected more from Panasonic. On the first set of headphones, only one of the headphones worked. I will say, when both headphones worked (second set) the sound quality was good. Also, very strangely, every time I plugged these into my phone the voice control on the phone would get activated - makes no sense since the microphone didn't work. I just really wanted these for the microphone and volume control feature so that not working was a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: C. Nardella

customer_reviews.title: Faulty wiring, won't stay in ears
customer_reviews.text: The first time I plugged this into my laptop the sound went in and out when the cable was moved. That usually does not happen unless I've used and abused my earbuds for months. Should not happen form the start. When I plug this into my phone the sound cuts in and out and sometimes the app just stops for some reason. Never happens with any of my other earbuds, wired or bluetooth. None of the ear rubber adapters fit well, either, so they constantly slide out of my ears. That never happened with any other earbuds I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: This used to be a good product.
customer_reviews.text: This used to be a good product. I have purchased these earbuds in the past and liked them. This time, however, as soon as I open them I could tell Panasonic had really cheaped-out on materials. Now they’re cheaply made, terrible sound quality, all around dreadful!
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Won’t be buying this brand again
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Panasonic brand headphones for years. These headphones used to last me months, even a whole year. Now when I buy them they only last a month or two. What a waste of money seeing as the price went up and the quality went down. I think they may have switched to a cheaper material to make them now. Not only did one side of my headphone go out but both! That’s never happen to me before. I Will not be Buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Quality declined to the point of being unusable
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these headphones several times before and they were always good sound quality for a low cost option even though they break within a year. Got my new ones today and the wires are thinner, they sound like being under water, terrible bass. They aren't even usable. Returning. DO NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: Zane Adams

customer_reviews.title: Broke Quickly, warranty doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I actually really like these earphones. They are good value for their price, I've bought several pairs of them. Unfortunately the latest pair after under 2 months broke (sound in one ear stopped working). This is worse than normal so I decided to try the warranty. The support hours are all terrible, for me, luckily they have an online form, or so I thought. Whenever I try to submit the online support form the page just refreshes itself and shows that no support forms have been submitted. @panasonic any way to fix this?
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Cooke

customer_reviews.title: 0 Star review. The product description is false
customer_reviews.text: 0/5 stars! These people are just going to lie to whomever so they can make more money. The product description describes a pair of earbuds that have a frequency response range of 5-20k but the ones I received were clearly marked 20-20k. FAIL! 20-20k, REALLY??? This isn't the 80s. There is this thing called bass. No, not the fish, you're pronouncing it wrong! To the owners of this company: go get a real job & stop wasting the world's dwindling resources. If I had wanted this frequency range, I could have bought any # of earbuds and not spent the time to find a pair that suggests that it dips lower in frequency response.
customer_reviews.author: Meather

customer_reviews.title: Six Years and Still Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: Back in 2014, I read that these earbuds were the best in the super-budget category (i.e. ~$15). I got mine exactly six years ago. I have used them heavily, and they have always sounded very good to me. For $15 earbuds, they sound awesome. I have had no problems at all. No sound quality decline. No shorting out wires. Nothing. They just work. I got this to be "disposable". If I lost them, no big deal. I'd just get another pair. But they have lasted longer than any of my ~$50 Etymotics. Every pair of those I had broke within 3-4 years of normal use. If you want some good earbuds at a budget price, these are the ones.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brett

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: Within ten minutes of opening the packaging and using them one of the earbuds stopped working unless the wire was held in a certain position. I've had this happen with other earbuds but NEVER the VERY FIRST DAY within TEN MINUTES of use. Absolutely unacceptable. This was a birthday gift for someone else, and it was so embarrassing to give them basically a useless broken gift. I will NEVER buy Panasonic again. I've bought earbuds that were less than half the price that have lasted over a year in perfect condition. DO NOT BUY THESE EARBUDS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One week old and already listening to static
customer_reviews.text: You take your chances with this one. If you are shipped the real deal, they are good. If you are shipped the fakes, good luck. We've received both - doesn't matter the seller (they are all mixed into and pulled from the same bin.
customer_reviews.author: Joie K.

customer_reviews.title: ... have previously ordered Panasonic ErgoFit earbuds and have always liked the feel and comfort of them so I ordered ...
customer_reviews.text: I have previously ordered Panasonic ErgoFit earbuds and have always liked the feel and comfort of them so I ordered these for the microphone. The microphone works pretty well, other people have told me they can hear me clearly but it does pick up movement noise so I have to try to not move the cord while on the phone. I was hoping there would be volume buttons on the microphone button as well but there is only one, to answer and end calls.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: They're earbuds and they work.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a bunch of these earbuds on Amazon and I will keep buying more. The sound quality is good for watching movies/tv shows and the ear pads work really well at muffling outside noise. They usually end up ripping where the wire meets the casing for either the left or right earbud. Mine usually last about a year and a half to two years before they either rip or I lose them, but for the price, I buy a few every two years to keep at my computer, in my car, or wherever there's even a slight chance I might need earphones. I've never had a problem with receiving counterfeit or cheaper quality earphones as others have.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought these headphones before and had no issues except for just user wear and tear but these pair I bought this time around are ANNOYING. I’ve NEVER EVER had a pair of headphones that activate Siri on their own or one earbud just cuts out after a week. I hate these more than anything on earth and that says a lot. They constantly activate Siri or play music by themselves and I can’t stand it anymore. I absolutely live on having headphones but I’ll suffer for two days and take the pleasure of throwing these in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Brown

customer_reviews.title: They don’t last
customer_reviews.text: My teenage kids loved these at first but they didn’t last. Now that we are spending so much time at home because of COVID they really need to use ear buds a lot. The buds themselves popped apart, and the wires showed wear and tear too, leaving my kids trying to hold them in just the right position because the sound would cut out if they move. These might be a good option for adults that don’t beat on them like my kids did.
customer_reviews.author: Annmarie MacAveeney

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality and comfort are ok, but weakly built earphones...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these since I owned a pair that's almost exactly the same and had them for almost 5 years. The pair I owned were fantastic, but this just seems like an extremely cheap knock-off version. I like the fit of these earphones and the sound quality was fine, but I had them maybe a week or two before the little casing for the microphone fell apart and the wires came loose--extremely disappointed in the build quality. Also, I tried to use these earphones with my electric keyboard but the sound would only come through when holding the microphone button which was really strange to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Speak up, or forever be silenced!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit of the ear pieces, and the durability of the headset (my toddler has pulled on the cord quite a bit and they are still going strong)! I took 2 stars off because I specifically bought them for Zoom visits, and for some reason, I have to speak up rather loudly for the mic to work. I am happy it doesnt catch breathing sounds, but i shouldn't have to hold the mic close to my lips for it to catch what I'm saying!
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Different colors are Different Products
customer_reviews.text: Different colors are different products/materials. Red with white/clear translucent silicone are excellent! I buy a pair about once each month for gifts and back-ups. The sound is amazing, as is their ability to block ambient noise. Only thing is that different colors are different products. -The green ones have different flimsy ear-pieces that cause suction in the ear canal—causing pain and damage to the eardrum. Stick with red. They’re not the prettiest, but they work and they’re so easy to find!
customer_reviews.author: Goodkat

customer_reviews.title: Tangled, shorted out, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: "I don't want to buy $250 wireless earbuds... I'll get these $10 wired earbuds, I'm sure they'll be great." -me when I added these to my cart. Splurge a little, don't waste money. I bought three pairs, thinking I'd keep them in different places. First pair shorted where the wire connects to the minijack plug. Second pair shorted where the wire met the left earbud. Third pair went in the trash and I bought the more expensive wired apple earbuds. They are still working.
customer_reviews.author: M. Silver

customer_reviews.title: Don't work
customer_reviews.text: Received these on time, that's the only positive thing. Out of the package only one side works. I bought them for my wife so I can't remember if it's the L or R. I don't think it matters, I got it on an Amazon deal so they were pretty cheap so not really worth my time or effort to return them. I don't recommend them, they are comfortable so maybe make good ear plugs but not good earbuds. You are better off paying more and getting a reliable pair.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased both an 'over-the-ear' and 'earbud' version of these Panasonic earphones, and they are both worthless. After only a few months they both stopped working for my kids as we do school from home during these COVID months. Don't waste your money with this company or their products.
customer_reviews.author: Happy in DBQ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality and fit for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these earbuds along with the Betron AX5, which also has good ratings. There was no comparison. I listen principally to classical music, orchestral and piano. Played the same music recordings through both earbuds. The Betrons had a harsh, tinny sound. The Panasonics gave a fuller, richer sound. Now you can't expect $200 earphone quality from these, but for the price, they're excellent. Also, Panasonic has better ergonomics than Betron, and the earbuds fit tightly but comfortably in the ear. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Naturephotoguy

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good. Hopefully not fragile.
customer_reviews.text: Have only had them for a day but love them. They sound a lot better than the ones they replaced. They fit in my ears well and don’t fall out while jogging. While no active noise cancelling, they fit so well that most outside noise doesn’t get through. My wife was apparently taking to me and I didn’t notice. No volume control. Only concern is how thin the wire to the actual earpieces are. I will have to be careful taking them out and not using the cord to pop them out. Will see if they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Newcombe

customer_reviews.title: Terrible tinny sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Apparently (from the reviews here) this item once had pretty decent sound quality for cheap earbuds. However, I can confirm that they sure don't now, I know what seriously good speakers and phones sound like, and I obviously wasn't expecting anything like that, but these things have an aggressively raw sound at the high end that is much worse than any earbuds I've ever heard - both genuine Apple and $5 imitations. These might be be better for speech intelligibility in a noisy environment, but listening to music for more than 5 minutes is torture.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Spofford

customer_reviews.title: Short in the wire
customer_reviews.text: These are cute, lightweight, and comfortable enough. I didn't expect much for like $8, and so I figured I got what I paid for. I have to wiggle the wire at the jack, and after a little static, they seem to stay working. I see headphones that look like these at the dollar store and it makes me wonder, but I don't think they were misrepresented here in any way. Once you get a good connection, the sound is great for audio books. which is what I use them for.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyBrookTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: There is a reason these earbuds have 58 thousand reviews
customer_reviews.text: These are the best $10 earbuds I have ever seen. Lots of people buy them because they are great. I got two, one for my wife and one for myself. We use them on our cell phones. The sound quality is major big improvement over the phone microphone and speaker. You can answer the phone with them plugged in using the answer button on your phone. You also use the phone volume buttons for volume control. Good sound, good quality, person on other end of calls says microphone sound is great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: NOOOOO!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to believe the reviews.. Panasonic changed the greatest headphones ever made!! The previous version, which i've purchased several of and still have after a couple years of occasional use, had the BEST sound quality. The bass and high notes were rich and clear! These new models do not produce the same quality sound. I'm no professional, but to me it seems like the bass is a little muddled, and there seems to be lack of a "mid" PANASONIC - PLEASE GO BACK TO THE OLD VERSIONS!!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great little earbuds for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for a cheap set of earbud headphones, really can't complain for the price. The mic on the line with a button to mute/end calls works wonderfully, as well as the voice quality as reported by people on the other end. Cons- The cord has developed a permanent twist and can tangle easily but hardly a complaint for $9 headphones, especially with the quality of sound you might find in $65 equivalent. Construction could be better, fairly low grade plastic and thin leads to the earbuds, but the minijack connector is angled, sturdy, and compact; again, not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money!
customer_reviews.text: I hope you read the reviews when you're thinking about a product.I bought these for my grandson and also bought the insurance. Yes I fell for it. When the earphones stopped working I thought yay! Good thing i have insurance. Amazon makes you talk to maker then after repeatedly reaching out and not being answered you're referred to insurance who just refers you to website. Isn't anybody out there? Anyway if you ask me, don't buy unless you're looking for disposable earphones and don't purchase insurance because it's a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: jwlsngms

customer_reviews.title: My favorite ear pods ever now prefer them over Apple ear pods.
customer_reviews.text: I think it will be enough to say now I prefer them over my Apple Ear pods, that I used for video editing also. Now i use this Ergofit for video editing too. I would say the quality is almost the same as the Apple ear pods. i mean slightly better. However, to me they are more comfortable to wear. Once in your ear they just stay there, but at the same time without feeling that they are there!. Then for this price!! Who needs Apple ear pods?
customer_reviews.author: Borisk

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work and can't do anything about it.
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift for Christmas and one ear piece didn't work at all. Only way to receive any replacement or to report any issues is to contact Panasonic directly, Amazon will not do anything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: OK, but broke after 13 months
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review because I bought these November 2018 and today the right ear went totally silent and only the left earbud works. I have no idea what could cause this but I am disappointed. In addition, the sound quality and noise cancellation are actually very good, I would say far superior to most earbuds I have tried, but if you go out walking with these the rubbing noises against your ear are just deafening. You can kind of tune it out but once you notice it, it's hard to ignore.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for kids
customer_reviews.text: Liked that these had good reviews and wouldn't break the bank. Was recommended that I have headphones with mics for my kids to start school remotely. These come in several colors. They also have 3 different sized rubber ear bud covers so you can custom fit them to your kid's ears. They seem to be comfortable, no complaints from my kids. One daughter loves the red ones, the other has the purple ones. Bought them in both colors, only writing one review.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2CLandC

customer_reviews.title: Broke in about a month
customer_reviews.text: I'm super disappointed by these headphones. I have owned about 2 or 3 pairs of these and each one lasted me at least a couple of years. This time, I decided to go for the black ones with the microphone (the other ones I'd gotten didn't have a mic), and the right earpiece went silent in less than a month. I'm super disappointed, especially since these were my go-to brand for inexpensive headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Lozano

customer_reviews.title: Decent Headphones, but Still Searching for Better
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of these headphones lasted a long time, longer than any previous, so I bought another, but the second pair non-mic earbud died fairly quickly with regular use. I'm pretty hard on earbuds, so I'm not a search for better ones. Another thing is that noise cancellation on these earbuds is not amazing, which is expected, but there are some better ones out there. Music quality was pretty good, but without some level of noise cancellation it's just that anything will be super hard to hear in a city. My current favorite are the similarly priced MAXROCK Sleep earplugs because they have two ear that give better noise cancellation, and they haven't broke in multiple months so far.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Carter

customer_reviews.title: Really like these headphones
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are always in short supply in my house and are always going missing, so I decided to get myself a decent, cheap pair to hide from the kids. I got these and they're great. They are really comfortable in my small ears and they fit great. The sound is great too. I liked them so much, I ordered another pair pretty much immediately to stash and keep in case these go bad, get lost, etc. They're definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: R. Spann

customer_reviews.title: Definitely consider these
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased many pair of these. Pros: Excellent sound quality for the money (I don't use a lot of bass). Stay in my ears (many/most buds fall out. I have very small ear openings. Inexpensive. Not a big deal if lost or damaged. Cons: and this is the reason for only 3 stars. The microphone is too sensitive. When I've used these with the phone and there is almost any ambient noise, the person on the other end of the line picks up every sound and I get frequent complaints that they cannot understand me due to the loud background noise. They find it very irritating. Doesn't have volume control...but what do you expect for around $10-12.
customer_reviews.author: William Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable - sound is ok.
customer_reviews.text: These are very basic earphones. The sound quality is ok with them, but I do not find them very comfortable at all. The covers are made of vinyl, and they do not fit in my ears as well as other brands I have tried. These are good for the price, but are not very high quality. Please mark if you find my review helpful. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: PeggyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: O.k. for the price... but flimsy cords
customer_reviews.text: Panasonic is a name I trust, but these seem very flimsy. The cords are very thin, so I've been ultra careful when using them. The sound is o.k. It's about what I expected for this low price. I only use them for watching movies or YouTube videos while in a chemo chair, so they should hopefully last for a while. They came with three sized earpieces for a good fit, so no complaints there. However, I would not have bought them if I had seen how thin the cords are though, so I can't really recommend them, because of that.
customer_reviews.author: Magnolia High

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but not really my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as I needed a new pair of ear buds. I don’t really need high end ones but also didn’t want to go the really cheap ones on here. They come with different size rubber buds but even swapping those I find the offset style of these to not be comfortable. The speakers sound fine and overal for the price they are ok but keep in mind it’s got an awkward design that for my ears just don’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior who uses ear buds only occasionally. When I needed to purchase a new set, I didn't shop for a pricey, high end, top quality product. I searched instead for a lower priced item. I crossed my fingers and hoped it would give acceptable performance. Well most times you get what you pay for, and that's what happened here. The day these ear buds were delivered, I tried them out. Only one ear has any sound. Nothing has changed... and each time I use these only the one ear works. There's not even a crackle of sound from the other ear. Don't buy these unless you want to purchase something that's already broken!
customer_reviews.author: L. F.

customer_reviews.title: Microphone must be held in hand
customer_reviews.text: I have used these every day for 2 months, and find that unless I hold the microphone at my mouth, people can not hear me speaking. If the microphone hangs on its own and happens to be pointing away from my body, people cannot hear me speaking. The wire is pliable, as it is with all earbuds, so you can't keep the mike pointing towards you. To pre-empt this problem I hold the mike during every call. Not worth it. Looking for another device.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Works for 3 months or less, not the same quality anymore. AVERAGE all around
customer_reviews.text: The first Panasonic headphones I got worked for more than a year and a half until my dog got to them and chewed them up. That was at least 3-4 years ago. Now, since I’ve gotten replacements the Panasonic headphones have been painfully average. They have a shelf life of about 3 months if used every day, and then the wiring will go broken on one side and you have maybe a month or two to use them with the broken one side and then they totally break. Painfully average but cheaper than the seinnheiser ones which also break!
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Don’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because they are Panasonic and I expected it would be a no brained. They do not work AND there is no easy return! Have to call Panasonic and wait 20 minutes or go to website with no weekend chat hours. What a pain!
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Failed within a week
customer_reviews.text: The first pair worked, but the sound wasn't good. One ear stopped working within a week. The replacement pair was far worse, and is different. The microphone is on the opposite wire, one ear is softer than the other, and even with the device on full volume, the sound is too soft. I wonder if the replacement ear buds were knock-offs. Sending the second pair back, this time for a refund instead of a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Build quality has gone downhill.
customer_reviews.text: Junk, it’s a shame they used to be so good. I had a pair of these for over a year, when they finally died I was happy to order another pair. The new pair lasted two weeks then one of the earbuds died. I ordered another pair and about three weeks later the same issue, one of the earbuds died. Two pairs dead in a month. The build quality is garbage, a real shame because the build quality used to be nice. There cheap and sound decent for the price but they break so often it’s not really worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Btop

customer_reviews.title: Great, cheap headphones that don't always last
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones and have gone through about a dozen pairs--with and without the mic--over the past few years. The good is that they're cheap, lightweight, and work well. The ear pieces are comfortable and stay in my ear well, unlike some other similar earphones I've tried. The bad is that they inevitably break and need to be replaced. Usually one of the earpieces will just stop working or the casing will crack. I've wondered if it would be more cost effective to stop replacing these periodically and just buy a nicer and more expensive headphone that won't break as often, but so far, haven't made that shift. For now, these definitely do what they're meant to do!
customer_reviews.author: TJL

customer_reviews.title: Fits well and works for phone calls
customer_reviews.text: These fit in the ear well and are comfortable. I haven't had any issues hearing music or voices and the microphone seems to work well, even when it's windy outside. My one ask that I would have would be to have volume buttons on the microphone piece so I wouldn't have to pull my phone out to change the volume. It does have a button that pauses audio playback (it might mute a phone call too), which is useful. These seem to be sturdy. I'll buy another pair if these last me more than a couple of months. If not, I'll update my review. Side note: Why is Amazon asking me if these are Moisture Wicking? lol
customer_reviews.author: Trixie Copperton

customer_reviews.title: No support after 90 days. Low life-span.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased the PANASONIC ErgoFit Earbud Headphones ~4 months ago. One of headphones (right, on the side with microphone) suddenly stopped working. Previously I also purchased 2 or 3 pairs of the same headdset before, neither worked for more than 1 year of casual use. Contacted support, they do not provide any support after 90 days. Looking for alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Frgile
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use at my home work computer. I plugged them in the day I got them and they had never been unplugged or had any wear and tear other than putting them in and out of my ears. Two months after I got them one of the channels died and I had to replace them. I can't imagine how they would hold up if you were plugging and unplugging them, folding them, carrying them around, etc. The search for a sturdy set of ear buds goes on!
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Knickelbine

customer_reviews.title: Survived washer and dryer AND playful cat’s claws
customer_reviews.text: Update: third accidental trip through washer AND dryer... still working like a charm. The sound quality is great! I should say they cost me $14.49 when I purchased them two years ago, making them such a good deal. The current price is $4 higher. Two years after my purchase, this is hands down the best earphones I’ve owned. The quality is amazing but what is more incredible is that they have survived not one, but two (accidental) trips through the washer and dryer, AND they survive my cat’s constant attempts to destroy them. My beloved cat has destroyed two of my apple headphones and yet with these ones he can’t seem to break them. I can’t possibly recommend them enough!!
customer_reviews.author: JiB

customer_reviews.title: Yep. They're Earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: My son goes through earbuds like you wouldn't believe. He has ASD. He needs them to function in the world. And he fidgets them constantly. I've tried every cheap set out there (after learning hard lessons with expensive ones - Bose earbuds are worth the dough if you're not going to rip them to pieces by picking at them and twirling them and whatnot). Panasonics sound good for the money and last - usually - up to a few months. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Earphones USED to be the bomb, now not so much!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair several years ago and they still work great and don't tangle. My mom needed a pair so I bought her the same ones. On the new pair only one side worked and they tangle like the sickens so asked for a replacement. Got the replacement pair and again only one side works and they are a tangled mess. Too bad the quality has downgraded over time because this used to be an awesome model of earphones!
customer_reviews.author: M Ross

customer_reviews.title: Tangled Up A Lot & Broke In 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: I only purchased these to listen to audio books or movies on my Kindles. The sound quality was good&the ear buds were comfortable. But they constantly tangled up. Then after only a couple of months one ear bud broke! Usually Panasonic has very good quality products. I can't even return them because they're only warrantied for 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: LuvReading

customer_reviews.title: Adequate, but not as amazing as people say
customer_reviews.text: These are good-enough earbuds for the price, and have a slim cord. The ear tips hold well in my ear and there are multiple ones to fit a range of ear sizes. Sound quality is OK. Nothing wrong with it per se, but nothing to write home about either--the sound isn't very full or robust. I'm satisfied enough with the purchase, but was expecting a bit more based on others' strong reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny. Great Fit, Tough as Nails, Reviewed Years After Purchase & Still Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: These are better at noise-cancelling than the ones designed to do that job and far less expensive. I beat them up mowing a large property and not once has a bud pulled loose from the earpiece. My motorcycle helmet has Bluetooth speakers but if I'm in a hurry I just use these and even in a snug helmet they work perfectly and I barely hear the external sounds (not exactly safe, but hey, it's all about the music and I am super watchful anyway). Great job!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi T.

customer_reviews.title: What did I expect for the price?
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in-ear headphones to listen to news and watch video at night on a device....but I was fairly disappointed at the sound quality. If I wanted better quality I knew I would have to pay more, but this unit has absolutely no bass frequency, no round bottom tones. I guess the only redeeming quality related to sounds is that there is no hissing, shrill sounds. Spend more and get more....I wish I had.
customer_reviews.author: Raphael Lieberman

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality - Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY, THESE EARBUDS ARE HORRIBLE. From the moment I put these earbuds in I found them to be extremely uncomfortable & the sound is not clear. Since the description on the Amazon website came with a satisfaction guarantee I felt reassured that this was a quality product & the reviews appeared to back this up. I have never been more wrong! These earbuds are NOT guaranteed nor are they returnable. Very disappointed in this product & will never purchase again. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck for inexpensive wired earbuds - decent bass - just be kind to them
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting to world-class audio for the low price paid, but it was pretty impressive. Honestly, I do have some concerns about the build - the wires to the buds are pretty small, after all - But - that audio quality is really pretty nice for the relatively low price. If you are tough on your headgear, I would probably say that these will sound great while they last - but not to expect them to last long. BUT, If you tend to take good care of your gear, the sound quality easily makes these worth the low price. There's always that trade-off when things are priced low.
customer_reviews.author: wopanese

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, you get what you pay for. These are pretty subpar; they don't handle bass well at all. In fact, one of the earbuds rattles so hard every time there's a beat drop that I'm afraid it's going to electrocute me. The other earbud literally just stopped working about two weeks of owning them. They're pretty comfortable, but one of them likes to fall out of my ear. There's pretty much no noise cancellation.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Cooklin

customer_reviews.title: I usually have bad luck with earbuds but these are perfect
customer_reviews.text: Earbuds are such a weird thing. They're either too cheap or too expensive and they BREAK so easily. They're also very uncomfortable. HOWEVER. These earbuds are so amazing. They slip in your ears without problems and the sound quality is pretty dang good for the price! I enjoy these as my ears don't end up aching at all when I wear them for long periods. Definitely a great buy and I'll be buying more for friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Boom Dynamite

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.text: I'be bought two pairs and each was a hit and miss, the original pair was wonderful. The sound quality was magnificent and clear. The best headphones that was cost effective against higher quality headphones. The only thing detracting this review is the piss poor quality of the second pair. The second pair came with its right headphone defective not to mention with the return policy I couldn't return the headphones so I was stuck with headphones that worked out of only one ear. My advice is this, buy at your own risk but it is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Der Adler des Mondes

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed this time around.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of these headphones over the last couple years and never had a problem. Good quality and exceptional sound for the money. Purchased these back in August but never opened them until today since my last pair held out longer than I anticipated. Out of the box the right side headphone only worked intermittently. Appears there is a faulty wire just before the wire meats the plug of the headphone. Can't return since it's now a couple months since the purchase. That's my bad. Live and learn. Open the package when it arrives and test. Even if you don't need the item at that time.
customer_reviews.author: amp

customer_reviews.title: The earbuds are a good fit, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds are a good fit, comfortable. The Mic is a little low and there is no clip to keep the cord close to your body. so if you're bending over to pick something up or even walking by a door handle, I've had it yank right out of my ear. With others that have a clip, you clip it to your shirt and its not dangling everywhere. Also if it had the clip the mic would stay closer to your mouth and in one position. Sometimes people say my voice comes in and out if I'm moving around. when I pull it up closer to my mouth with my hand, they can hear me well.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: NOT RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.text: I do not understand what has happened, but I can no longer recommend these earbuds. I have ordered these and other, similar Panasonic earbuds over the years and have been impressed by their sound quality and durability even after frequent and long-term use. When I just received these, I found them to have an extremely tinny sound and a cheap feel, tantamount to what you would find from a supplier of cheap street vendor items. It must be some sort of knock-off and I would not recommend purchasing them. Unfortunately, this has soured me on purchasing future Panasonic products, a company I have always thought of as a high-quality brand. No more.
customer_reviews.author: Joe in L.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great little headphones!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these specific headphones. After 5 years, I lost my first set. I was delighted they still made them. I am rough on headphones. They almost always end up with a broken wire that results in a short or static popping- NEVER had that issue with these. SOUND QUALITY rivals some of the more pricier brands I’ve head for WAY LESS money. Best headphones I’ve had in my 47 years on Earth. I found my original pair 36 hours after the new set showed up- figures!!! LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a backup pair for when I am in the gym and my wireless bluetooths have powered down. I used these about two times. Yes you read correctly, two times. They did not work after the 2nd time. I saw that they had tons of favorable reviews which is why I purchased in the first place. Maybe I am just one of the few that had a bad experience, but unfortunately for me the product turned out to be horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good size for small ears, not a great sound.
customer_reviews.text: I like these because they actually fit inside my ear, and aren't constantly popping out. I have tiny ears and with the smallest size, they fit perfectly. Sound quality isn't bad, but also isn't great. I don't hear very well in the first place, so I'm trying to consider that fact. With these, I can hear a lot of noises clearly, like rain or high notes of a piano. There does not seem to be any bass, whatsoever. Even a song that is sung with bass in their voice, sounds a bit hollow. Conclusion: I will use these until I can find another set that sounds great AND fits in my tiny ears.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product - People Keep Taking It From Me
customer_reviews.text: These are my go-to earbuds. I’ve ordered quite a few of these. Pros: Great price Sound quality has never disappointed Best noise cancelling earbuds I’ve used Most comfortable earbuds for me and my wife Cord is better than some for not tangling Sturdy, original pair has lasted several years with no sign of wear (still working great) Cons: Honestly, my only complaint is that they are so appealing that my wife or friends want to take them. Not really a con, just thought I’d warn you. 100% would recommend. If you aren’t looking for high-tech listening devices (wireless, non-earbud style, with mic, etc.) these are your best bet.
customer_reviews.author: Dale K.

customer_reviews.title: Great For Multiple Kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 14 year old and he says they are perfect for what he needs. They allow sound to come through louder than most other headphones. These almost cancel out noise too well, he often can't hear his little brother or me when we are trying to speak with him. We typically have to wave in his direction for him to know we are needing him. These are GREAT for traveling with multiple kids who dislike the same stuff. So far they are holding up to kids playing and wearing them, as of now we have zero complaints and I would def buy these again if I need another pair! They are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Angellynn

customer_reviews.title: long-lasting earbuds with great sound quality & noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: best earbuds ever, this my third time buying a pair of Panasonic’s (because i lose them; not because they break, in fact they never do!) i tend to be careless with my earbuds and they get thrown around in my backpack and they other places but they never break! the sound quality is amazing, especially for the low price, and the noise cancellation is perfect and blocks out everything without having to go up to top volume and hurting your ears. these have been my go-to earbuds for years now! I definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thak

customer_reviews.title: it’s pretty hard to go wrong
customer_reviews.text: For twelve bucks, it’s pretty hard to go wrong. These replaced a $25 pair of buds that sounded about the same but were incredibly uncomfortable. Those had replaced a $125 pair of buds that lasted me darn near 10 years. I’m skeptical of the longevity these days, but these are a bargain even if they only last a year. Sound is decent, if not a little muddy and boomy. But that’s to be expected at this price point. For casual listening they're perfectly fine. Where these excel most is comfort — by far the most comfortable pair I buds I’ve owned. The ergo fit sits in my ear nicely without being tight and doesn’t move around even if I do.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with iPhone 8
customer_reviews.text: It said it was iPhone compatible. Not iPhone 8... ::sigh:: I’ll keep them for my computer and continue searching for iPhone 8 compatible earbuds since the ones that Apple makes don’t stay in my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Silver Star Wife

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly good sounding (no-mic) earbuds for the price
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds (I have the no mic version) have come to be known by professional reviewers as surprisingly good for the price, these reviews are spot on. I am truly surprised at the quality of sound you get from these for the low price that you pay, perhaps they don’t have world class treble/high end however if you wear them upside down in your ear canal (as other reviewer’s here on Amazon have noted) they have surprisingly good bass and totally acceptable treble. At this price give it a shot you really don’t have much to lose and at the very least you’ll have a reasonable set of backup buds should your higher end buds break.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Firmly stay in place
customer_reviews.text: There’s one thing you’ll never have to worry about with these earbuds, and that’s them falling out. You can jerk your head around or tug on them all you want and they will stay in exactly the same place forever, its kinda nice, because its always a pet peeve of mine when earbuds slide out on their own. I even did a test and hung a liter of water from the cord and they stay in my ears! Haha Other than that, I'm perfectly happy with the sound, and the amount of noise that they block out is incredible. I've bought 3 of these, one for me and my wife and one to leave at work.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: The volume doesn't work on the cord.
customer_reviews.text: I paid the extra money to get the volume control on the cord. I was disappointed to find it doesn't work at all. I got these to listen to audio books. I haven't tried them with music yet. So far the sound is clear. The cord is a useful length. It purple color is like the photo. It was a little difficult changing the ear cushion but that is because it really stays on. It comes with 3 sizes. I use the smallest size. The earphones are not comfortable for me to sleep with when I lay on my side. So far they haven't fallen out of my ears but I'm not moving that much with them.
customer_reviews.author: FaerylochTop Contributor: Pets

product_meta.title: Panasonic ErgoFit In-Ear Earbud Headphones RP-HJE120K Dynamic Crystal-Clear Sound, Ergonomic Comfort-Fit, 9mm, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:No MicThe Panasonic ErgoFit In Ear Earbuds Headphones RP HJE120 K are the perfect combination of style, comfort and most of all, high quality sound. With three included sets of earpads (S/M/L), you’ll get a custom, comfortable fit that won’t slip out. Choose from five vivid color options with color matching earbuds and cord to best complement your style and mood. Large 9mm drivers with neodymium magnets along with a wide frequency response and smart ergonomic fit deliver dynamic, crystal clear sound while helping to keep out unwanted outside noise. The 3.6 feet cord threads comfortably through clothing and bags.

feature_bullets: Wired in ear headphones perfect for exercising; with 3 sets of ear pads (S/M/L), Headphones stay in your ears while keeping surrounding noise out
